questions.question: Economics deals primarily with the concept of
options: change
power
poverty
scarcity

questions.question: Scarcity exists when
options: the price of a good rises
society can meet the wants of every individual
there is less of a good or resource available than people wish to have
there is less than an infinite amount of a resource or good

questions.question: Economics is defined as the study of
options: how society manages its scarce resources
business
central planning
government regulation

questions.question: A good definition of equity would be
options: efficiency
eliminating extreme affluence
fairness
everyone receiving the same income

questions.question: When government policies are being designed,
options: increasing efficiency usually results in more equity
there is usually a tradeoff between equity and efficiency
equity can usually be achieved without an efficiency loss
equity and efficiency goals are usually independent of each other

questions.question: The opportunity cost of an item is
options: what you give up to get that item
always equal to the dollar value of the item
always less than the dollar value of the item
the number of hours needed to earn the money to buy it

questions.question: Ryan spends an hour studying instead of going for a bike ride. The opportunity cost to him of studying is
options: the improvement in his grades from studying for the hour
the enjoyment and exercise he would have received had he gone for a bike ride
the difference between the improvement in his grades from studying minus the enjoyment of a bike ride
zero Since Ryan chose to study rather than to ride his bike, the value of studying must have been greater than the value of the bike ride

questions.question: A rational decision maker takes an action only if the
options: marginal benefit is greater than the marginal cost
average benefit is greater than the average cost
marginal benefit is less than the marginal cost
marginal benefit is greater than both the average cost and the marginal cost

questions.question: A marginal change is a
options: long-term trend
change for the worse
small incremental adjustment
large, significant adjustment

questions.question: Economists understand that people respond to
options: the wishes of policymakers
tax breaks, but not tax hikes
threats more than rewards
incentives

questions.question: Which is the most accurate statement about trade?
options: Trade can make every nation better off
Trade makes some nations better off and others worse off
Trade helps rich nations and hurts poor nations
Trading for a good can make a nation better off only if the nation cannot produce that good

questions.question: If Canada is better than the United States at producing hockey sticks, but the United States is better than Canada at producing roller blades, the United States should
options: put a quota on the amount of Canadian hockey sticks imported
subsidize its hockey stick industry so that it can compete with Canadian hockey sticks
sell roller blades to Canada, and buy Canadian hockey sticks
impose a tariff on Canadian hockey sticks in order to protect jobs in the US roller blade industry

questions.question: One advantage market economies have over central planning is that market economies
options: solve the problem of scarcity
are more efficient
establish government economic control
provide an equal distribution of goods and services to consumers

questions.question: The term market failure refers to
options: an unsuccessful advertising campaign
a situation in which the market on its own fails to allocate resources efficiently
a situation in which competition among firms becomes ruthless
a firm which is forced out of business because of losses

questions.question: If a copper refinery does NOT bear the entire cost of the smoke it emits, it will
options: emit too much smoke
emit lower levels of smoke
emit an acceptable level of smoke
eliminate all smoke so as to avoid the entire cost of the smoke

questions.question: The two best reasons for a government to intervene in a market are to
options: promote equity and to raise revenues
promote equity and to promote efficiency
promote efficiency and to raise revenues
raise revenues and to promote stability

questions.question: Market power refers to the
options: power of the government to regulate a market
relative importance of a market to the overall economy
power of a single person (or small group of people) to unduly influence market prices
ability of a person or group of people to successfully market new products

questions.question: The income of a typical worker in a country is most closely linked to which of the following?
options: population
government policies
labor unions
productivity

questions.question: Productivity is defined as the
options: amount of goods and services produced from each hour of a worker’s time
number of workers required to produce a given amount of goods and services
amount of labor which can be saved by replacing workers with machines
actual amount of effort workers put into an hour of working time

questions.question: Inflation causes
options: productivity to increase
the value of money to rise
the value of money to fall
the government to lower taxes

options: Yes

options: Yes

options: Yes
No

options: Yes
No

options: Yes

options: Yes

options: Yes

options: Yes
No

options: Yes

options: True
False
